English.alert.about: Create ringtones that can be used with alarms to automatically run shortcuts at scheduled times during the day.
English.alert.garageband.docs: Tap OK to open AlarmCuts docs in Safari and GarageBand  if you are running on an iOS device that supports Split View, place GarageBand and Safari side-by-side to follow along with the instructions as you create ringtones and alarms.
English.alert.newAlarm:
Tap OK to open Clock.

Edit the “{{sound}}” alarm for {{time}} and set its Sound to the ringtone “{{sound}}” you created in GarageBand.

Set your desired repeat interval for the alarm.

Finally, disable Snooze in the alarm.

NOTE: If your iOS device is locked when the alarm goes off, your shortcut may not run properly.
English.alert.newAlarm.title: Alarm Created for {{time}}
English.alert.record.1:
Tap OK to begin recording a “Hey Siri” phrase for automatically running one of your shortcuts.

Say the phrase quickly (under a second), this iOS may start processing the Siri request before your ringtone sound stops playing.

aAfter recording, you will save the slind file and have the opportunity to open GarageBand to turn it into a ringtone.
English.alert.record.1.title: New Audio Recording (1/2)
English.alert.update.none: You are currently running the latest version of AlarmCuts.
English.alert.update.none.title: No Update Available
English.error.offline: You must be connected to the internet for this feature of AlarmCuts to work.
English.error.offline.title: No Network Connection
English.prompt.garageband:
Create a Ringtone (2/2)

Next, you will create a ringtone for use by alarms in Clock. Tap Open GarageBand and follow these steps.

1. Create a new song in GarageBand.

2. Tap the Tracks View button to open Tracks view, tap the Loop Browser button in the control bar, then tap Files.

Tap “Browse items from the Files app,” then navigate to the iCloud Drive/AlarmCuts/Sounds folder.

3. Tap and hold on the “{{sound}}” file.

4. Drag the audio file from the list to Tracks view.

5. Save the file as a ringtone.
English.prompt.main:
⏰ AlarmCuts

Record sounds to be used as alarm ringtones that automatically trigger your shortcuts.
English.prompt.new: When do you want the alarm to go off?
English.prompt.record.duplicate: There is already a sound file with the same name. Replace the file with the new sound, keep both, or skip?
English.prompt.record.name: Enter the name for this sound file.
